intro: Stachys costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant features square, hairy stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink to purple in color, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
